intro: Jacobaea fuchsii, commonly known as the Alpine ragwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its flowers are yellow and are surrounded by a ring of pale green leaves, which help in photosynthesis at high altitudes. Jacobaea fuchsii is also known for its medicinal properties, though it can be toxic to livestock if ingested in large quantities.
